item.title: U.S. warns of Iranian cyber threats on critical infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: U.S. cyber agencies, the FBI, and NSA issued an urgent warning today about potential cyberattacks from Iranian-affiliated hackers targeting U.S. critical infrastructure. [...]

item.title: Germany asks Google, Apple to remove DeepSeek AI from app stores
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Berlin Commissioner for Data Protection has formally requested Google and Apple to remove the DeepSeek AI application from the application stores due to GDPR violations. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 now blocks email bombing attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says its Defender for Office 365 cloud-based email security suite will now automatically detect and block email bombing attacks. [...]

item.title: Switzerland says government data stolen in ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The government in Switzerland is informing that sensitive information from various federal offices has been impacted by a ransomware attack at the third-party organization Radix. [...]

item.title: Hikvision Canada ordered to cease operations over security risks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Canadian government has ordered Hikvision's subsidiary in the country to cease all operations following a review that determined them to pose a national security risk. [...]

item.title: Microsoft warns of Windows update delays due to wrong timestamp
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed a new known issue causing delivery delays for June 2025 Windows security updates due to an incorrect metadata timestamp. [...]

item.title: Europol helps disrupt $540 million crypto investment fraud ring
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Spanish authorities have arrested five individuals in Madrid and the Canary Islands, suspected of laundering $540 million (€460 million) from illegal cryptocurrency investment schemes and defrauding more than 5,000 victims. [...]

item.title: FBI: Cybercriminals steal health data posing as fraud investigators
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has warned Americans of cybercriminals impersonating health fraud investigators to steal their sensitive information. [...]

item.title: Over 1,200 Citrix servers unpatched against critical auth bypass flaw
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Over 1,200 Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway appliances exposed online are unpatched against a critical vulnerability believed to be actively exploited, allowing threat actors to bypass authentication by hijacking user sessions. [...]

item.title: Google rolls out Veo 3 video generator, try it for free using credits
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google is rolling out Veo 3 to everyone using Vertex AI, which is an ML-testing platform provided by Google Cloud. [...]

item.title: Bluetooth flaws could let hackers spy through your microphone
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: Vulnerabilities affecting a Bluetooth chipset present in more than two dozen audio devices from ten vendors can be exploited for eavesdropping or stealing sensitive information. [...]

item.title: Cloudflare open-sources Orange Meets with End-to-End encryption
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cloudflare has implemented end-to-end encryption (E2EE) to its video calling app Orange Meets and open-sourced the solution for transparency. [...]

item.title: Let’s Encrypt ends certificate expiry emails to cut costs, boost privacy
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Let's Encrypt has announced it will no longer notify users about imminent certificate expirations via email due to high costs, privacy concerns, and unnecessary complexities. [...]
